DOC.HEAD: Man Charged With Using Mirror to Harass Pilots
DOC.TEXT: A man who said small planes buzzing over his desert homestead drowned out his portable radio has been charged with using a 4-foot-square mirror to flash blinding sunlight into pilots' eyes. Alcide Chaisson, 69, who lives in a trailer near Crystalaire Airport, was cited Friday for obstructing a flight path, Los Angeles County Deputy District Attorney Cynthia L. Ulfig said. ``It could be very hazardous,'' Ms. Ulfig said. ``They were being blinded as they landed and took off.'' Chaisson lives about 45 miles northeast of downtown Los Angeles. Crystalaire Airport is a small airfield serving private aircraft. The offense carries six months in jail and a $1,000 fine. ``The landing was the part that bothered us most. It was definitely a real obvious distraction,'' said George Thomas, who flies tow planes used to launch gliders.
